alert.note: Alert for Central Tangipahoa; East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern Livingston; Northern Tangipahoa; Southern Livingston; St. Helena; West Feliciana; Western Ascension (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 12:24PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern West Feliciana, St. Helena, Livingston, East Feliciana, southern Tangipahoa and eastern East Baton Rouge Parishes, southeastern Wilkinson and southwestern Amite Counties through 115 PM CDT... At 1224 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Watson, or 10 miles north of Denham Springs, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Hammond, Zachary, Denham Springs, Jackson, Clinton, Greensburg, Amite, Ponchatoula, Walker, Amite City, Livingston, Centreville, Independence, Roseland, French Settlement, Albany, Slaughter, Port Vincent and Wilson. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 12 between mile markers 7 and 51. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 17 and 52. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Tangipahoa; East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern Livingston; Northern Tangipahoa; Southern Livingston; St. Helena; West Feliciana; Western Ascension
